titleStmt.title: AN EPITAPH VPON THE EXCELLENT COVNTESSE OF HVNTJNGDON.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: AN EPITAPH VPON THE EXCELLENT COVNTESSE OF HVNTJNGDON.

monogr.title: A sermon preached at Ashby De-la-zouch in the countie of Leicester : at the funerall of the truely noble and vertuous lady Elizabeth Stanley one of the daughters and coheires of the Right Honourable Ferdinand late Earle of Derby, and late wife to Henrie Earle of Huntingdo the fifth earle of that familie. The 9. of February. Anno Dom. 1633. By I.F
monogr.author: I. F.

div.head: AN EPITAPH VPON THE EXCELLENT COVNTESSE OF HVNTJNGDON.

lg.l: THE cheife perfections of both Sexes joyn'd,
With neithers vice nor vanity combin'd.
Of this our age the wonder, loue, and care,
The example of the following, and dispaire.
Such beauty, that from all hearts loue must flow:
Such maiesty, that none durst tell her so.
A wisdome of so large and potent sway,
Romes Senare might haue wisht, her Conclaue may.
Which did to earthly thoughts so seldome bow,
Aliue She scarce was lesse in heaven, then now.
So voyd of the least pride, to her alone
Such once there was: but let thy greife appeare
Reader, there is not: Huntingdon lies here.

closer.signed: By him who saies what he saw FALKLAND.
